definition: to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: She x-ed out most of what she had written.
sentences.chinese: 她打叉劃掉了已經寫出的大部分文字。

sentences.english: It is such a great feeling to cross completed tasks off of a list one by one.
sentences.chinese: 把清單上要乾的事情一件一件劃掉的感覺真的超爽哦。

sentences.english: Be sure to black out the previous addresses and remove the used stamps.
sentences.chinese: 記得劃掉之前的地址並移去用過的郵票。

sentences.english: Rule out neatly any words which you don't wish Jack to read.
sentences.chinese: 把你不想讓傑克看的詞句整整齊齊地劃掉。

sentences.english: Complete and get the big marker out to cross them off the list.
sentences.chinese: 完成這些，然後用記號筆將它們從清單中醒目地劃掉。

sentences.english: When you make a mistake, cross it out; don; 't use parentheses.
sentences.chinese: 當你寫錯時，把它劃掉，不要用。

sentences.english: He took a pen and struck out two paragraphs from his essay.
sentences.chinese: 他拿起筆把他的文章劃掉了兩段。

sentences.english: I struck the Sweetheart through,and changed it into Dear.
sentences.chinese: 我把“甜心”一詞劃掉，改成了“親愛的”。

sentences.english: Delete her name from the list of members.
sentences.chinese: 把她的名字從成員名單中劃掉。

sentences.english: His name is left out of the membership list.
sentences.chinese: 他的名字從會員名單中劃掉了。

sentences.english: He stroked the name of himself with his pen.
sentences.chinese: 他用鋼筆劃掉了他自己的名字。

sentences.english: Please cancel the words which are useless.
I don't want to see her. Strike off her name.
sentences.chinese: 我不想見到她，把她的名字劃掉。

sentences.english: Cross off those alternatives that most likely will not happen to you.
sentences.chinese: 劃掉那些最不會在你身上發生的選項。
